availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Platt (Fayette County, baker and grocer)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, baker and grocer. England native. Married to Anne Platt. Father of Sarah Platt and Ida Platt. Baker in Fayette County in 1860. Grocer in Fayette County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, 3rd Ward, p.568.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, 4th Ward, p.330A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, 4th Ward, p.375D.
